Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2008 05:55PM iaksma wrote: You guys are great!  I feel like I'm bipolar.  One moment I am bawling my head off and the next I feel like if I do have cancer, I'm just going to deal with it like anything else that gets thrown at me in life.  Ah, the joys of WAITING.  I will be keeping positive thoughts for all of us waiting for biopsy results, as well as positive thoughts for anyone here no matter what their situation is.  Thanks for the support.
Posts.Title: Newbie here, waiting on biopsy results iaksma slcst12

Posts.Content: iaksma wrote: How do you handle the WAITING?  I had a stereotactic biopsy yesterday and should have the results by the end of the week.  I had a routine mammo about a month ago, then got called back for magnified images of the left breast.  The radiologist showed me a small group of 4 microcalcifications behind the nipple.  They looked irregular in shape to me (I think that's not a good sign?) The biopsy went just fine, but since the radiologist told me she would guess I have a less than 50% chance of having cancer, I am on this roller coaster ride with my emotions.  One minute I think to myself, it's not a problem, it's a challenge I will deal with.  Next I think of my husband, kids, and my parents and how they would cope without me.  I have not yet told my children (15 and 11 years) because I don't want to worry them unless I know for sure. It's hard to keep it from them though.  My husband is a great support and I've told only a few close friends.  Anyhow, if you have coping tips, please let me know because I'm in desparate need.  Thanks in advance for your help!  I wish I weren't here, but I'm glad this is available! :) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Newbie here, waiting on biopsy results iaksma slcst12
